inn1.comm: Clatter! What a dramatic start! Upul Tharanga has lost his off stump. It was full in length, landed around the middle  and off, and moved towards the off stump. Tharanga was caught at the crease, neither forward nor back, and pushed out at it.  He lunged out at it in the last moment and ended up stumbling out of his crease. The ball moved past the desperate waft and crashed into the off stump. Timber! The bails fly! PK jumps for joy.
lands outside off and shapes in, pushed back down the track
stumbles out of the crease to jab this away-going delivery to the point region
walks couple of steps down the track and withdraws his bat away from the away-going delivery

lands outside off, shapes in a touch and is left alone. Posthumous swing occurs then. And Dhoni puts his right hand out rather gingerly and has probably hurt his fingers again. He doesn't collect it cleanly.
on the middle and leg, tries to flick it away and it runs off the pad
in the corridor outside off stump, left alone
floated it full around middle stump, Sanga drives it straight to mid-on. He would feel that he could have done better than that.
very wide outside off stump and Dhoni shuffles to his left to take it in front of the first slip
allows this length delivery to bounce away to Dhoni
gets behind the line of the length delivery and defends
in the channel outside off, Sanga covers the off stump and shoulders arms
straightens outside off, pushed to short cover point and they hare down for a single
full in length, around off stump, driven wide of mid-off for a single
fullish, on the middle stump line, turned to the on side.
lands around the middle stump line and moves gently towards off, pushed back down the track
flicks this length delivery to deep backward square-leg where Nehra fumbles to give away an extra run
just outside off stump, straightens, punched to short extra cover

full in length, on the middle and leg, worked through midwicket. You can sense what is happening there. Dilshan is in the mood to flick and PK is striving for that dream ball that swings away from the middle and leg. So far its Dilshan who is winning
Whackity whack! It was a shortish ball around the middle and leg line, around chest-high, and Dilshan pulls it to the left of the lunging fielder placed in front of square-leg. Nehra holds his head.
pushes this fuller delivery wide of mid-on for a single

The short ball works. Dilshan pulled it wide of the fielder couple of deliveries ago but Sangakkara has now holed out to backward square-leg region. It was below chest-high actually but Sanga was late on the shot and ended up edging it high. Ojha ran in from the deep backward square-leg to collect that. It was the shortish ball on the off stump line and Sanga tried to fetch it from there. It wasn't a bouncer or anything: between waist and chest high.
gets forward to defend the length delivery to covers
short in length around off stump line, defended to the off side
around the off stump, eased to covers with that silken timing that Mahela possesses
leans forward to push the length delivery to the off side
tries the bouncer - too high and outside off... left alone
Awww! Awesome. It was a length delivery just outside off stump and Dilshan creams it on the up and to the left of mid-off. Superbly struck.
this time he goes back to place the length delivery through extra cover
length delivery that straightens outside off and Mahela adjusts to defend to the off stump
on the middle and leg, clipped behind square-leg
fullish, on the middle, flicked to Ishant standing at wide mid-on
in the zone outside off stump and Mahela shoulders arms. Nehra has a look which i am interpreting it as "ooh that wasn't far away from your off stump"
slower one, on the middle, tapped to the on side
gets forward to push it towards mid-on and by the time Ishant runs in, they complete the single
around the off stump, Dilshan taps it close on the off side, thinks about a single but Mahela shouts NO
on the middle and leg, turned to that fielder in front of square-leg
on the middle stump line, Mahela leans forward and across and wrists it past square-leg

Loud shout and it has been given. Height was the question. Mahela trudges off slowly. It cut in from outside off and trapped him in line. It hit him above the knee roll. The bat was nowhere in line. Got to see the replays to check whether it would have gone over. So do hang on. Mahela turns behind to have a look as he walks off. Hawk eye says it would have clipped the very top of the leg stump
Two slips in and they watch Samaraweera defend this to the on side
around the off stump, cutting away at the last moment and SAmaraweera jabs it out
in the zone outside off stump, left alone
pushes this towards mid-off
around the pads, rolls behind square-leg region
gets back and across to defend the length delivery to the on side of the pitch

Edged to the left of the diving Dhoni. It was a length delivery that straightened outside off stump and Samaraweera has a waft and pushes his bat outside the line. The ball catches the edge and it bounces short of the keeper and goes to his left
stays back to keep this delivery out to the on side. Nehra is getting the ball to straighten
goes back and across to push it to mid-off
lands outside off stump and moves away, left alone
on the middle stump line, moving in from around off, Dilshan just about manages to jab it out
goes for the bouncer and Dilshan top edges the pull safely beyond square-leg and runs hard to complete three runs.
lands on a length outside off and shapes away. Sam chased it away from the body and the ball flew past the edge
slower, around off stump line, steered to backward point. Confusion over the single. Kohli fires the throw at the striker's end with Sam stretching his bat inside the crease.
fuller and sliding down leg, Samaraweera falls over a bit on that front foot while trying to flick and is struck on the pad
in the zone outside off, straightens, left alone
Tries the short ball but this time Dilshan plays the best pull shot he has played today. He swiveled nicely to pull it clear of the square-leg fielder
around the off stump line, punched to mid-off
goes for the pull again but mistimes it towards short midwicket. It was on the middle and off line
stays adjacent to the line of the length delivery and punches it on the up but can't beat Rohit in covers
Thump! Ok this is the best pull shot he has played. It was the short ball on the middle, he cleared the front foto and crashed it over midwicket. Delicious Whack!
A deep square-leg is in place now. Another bouncer, above head-high this time, and Dilshan tries to scoop it over Dhoni! No wood on leather, though
steers this fuller-length delivery to point
full in length on the middle, worked past square-leg for a single
back of length, moves towards middle, Dilshan pushes it back to Ishant
full in length, on the middle and leg, driven to mid-off.
this one is on the leg and middle, from short of length, tapped to short midwicket
dabs this length delivery away . Dilshan has remained very cautious so far this over
around the off stump line, punched to covers
around the off and middle, worked to midwicket
gets behind the line of the short-of-length delivery and punches it to mid-on
leans forward to punch this to right of short extra cover where Raina makes a tumbling save
full in length, outside off stump, tilts in, Sam was shaping for the off drive but edged it to midwicket
bangs it in short around the off stump. Dilshan shaped for the pull shot but decided not to play it in the end. He dropped his wrists and took the ball on his chest
the short ball again, pulled away to deep square-leg fielder
moves in from outside off stump, Sam defends to covers
climbs from short of length, moves in around the middle and off line, tucked to square-leg
stays back to guide this to Kohli at backward point

What a soft dismissal! Almost contrived! Samaraweera walked right across the stumps and worked the back-of-length delivery on the off and middle stump line straight to short midwicket. Absolute dolly of a catch. Sri Lanka are wobbling here. Samaraweera was looking to whip it to square-leg but ended up lobbing it to short midwicket
greets him with a bouncer and Angelo ducks
on the pads, Angelo withdraws his bat and takes it on his pad
cuts in towards middle stump line, Dilshan stays beside the line and punches it to point
bangs it in short outside off and Dilshan goes for the pull but mistimes it and the ball rolls to short midwicket
tries another short delivery but slips it down the leg side for a wide
on the middle stump line, Dilshan taps it to Virat at backward point
around the off stump, again some bounce on offer there, punched to covers
bounces outside off  and straightens, Dilshan goes for the cut but the bat goes under the ball
on the pads, tucked behind square-leg
shortish delivery, pulled past midwicket for a single. He didn't quite connect properly.
short in length, moves in towards the middle stump line, deflected to short midwicket
on the middle stump and it has been again worked to short midwicket. Angelo goes tapping down the pitch.
lands around off stump and tilts away, pushed to left of mid-off for a single
the short ball arrives, pulled away to long-leg for a single
in the zone outside off stump, left alone
full in length and cuts in from outside off stump, Dilshan goes for the on-the-up off drive and edges it to his pad.
straightens outside off stump and Dilshan punches it neatly but can't pierce the off-side field
high and harmless bouncer outside off. Wide surely? Not called so.. Hmmm
punches this one to Raina at covers. Four dot balls. SL 49 for 4.
leans across to punch it again to Raina. Dilshan has a look at PK and smiles
short in length this time, Dilshan backs away and chops it to backward point
short in length,  bouncing into the middle and leg line, clipped past square-leg
on the pads, worked to short midwicket
short in length, around the off stump line, steered to backward point
sprays this to the pads and Dilshan helps it around the corner, four down to fine-leg region
on the middle stump line, Dilshan leans forward to push it to the off side
short in length outside off stump, Dilshan stays beside the line and cuts. But he can't get it past backward point.
Top shot! no Violence. It was full on the middle and leg and Angelo just caressed it to the right of mid-on. It raced away
leans forward to defend the flighted delivery on the middle stump line
slips this down the leg side and Dhoni doesn't collect it cleanly but gets his body behind it
leans forward to push it back to Ojha
on the middle and leg line, turned to square-leg for a single

flighted full outside off stump, driven to right of sweeper cover where DK makes a diving stop. Dilshan thinks there was an extra run in it and is not too happy with Angelo. DK had lobbed the ball softly towards short midwicket ..
gets forward to push this defensively to the off side
takes couple of steps down the track, Ishant shortens the length and Angelo defends
fuller in length, straightens around off stump line, Angelo gets right back to defend that
short in length on the middle, Angelo goes back to deflect it to Sehwag at short midwicket
Wallop! Imperious! He leaned forward and simply knifed it on the up and over mid-on. Just one bounce and it goes over the boundary. Lovely clean hit
length delivery that straightens on the off, Angelo seemed to give an impression that he was expecting a shorter one and lunged out in the end to stab it to the leg side
works this back-of-length delivery on the middle-stump line to short midwicket
on the middle stump line, pushed to the off side
gets forward to tap it to short mid-off region
quickish, on the middle stump line, almost going on straight but Dilshan backs away to play a late cut and gets the ball to the left of short third man!
this one is slower and spins away from the off, Dilshan taps it again to the left of Jadeja at short third man
fuller this time, driven to Sehwag standing pretty straight at short extra cover
this time Dilshan cuts through backward point for couple more runs. Ojha looks perplexed.
moves down the leg side and Dhoni collects

short in length on the middle, Angelo has been working similar deliveries straight to short midwicket so far. This time, though, he pushes it with a straighter bat and will get a single through mid-on
length delivery on the off stump line, punched to backward point where Virat makes a mess of a regulation stop
banged in short around off stump line, swatted towards deep square-leg. He just lapped it around the corner
head-high bouncer on the middle and Dilshan pulls it down behind square-leg
back of length outside off stump, jabbed off the inner edge to his pad
cuts in from outside off, Dilshan punches it sweetly to sweeper cover
gets behind this to tap it to short midwicket. He then suggests he should have whacked it over midwicket!
this one goes down the leg side for a wide
straightens on the middle, Dilshan tries to steer it to cover point but edges it to square-leg
leans forward to defend to cover point for a single

he suggested in the first ball of the over that he should have gone over midwicket. He tries it this time to his own peril. It was a flighted delivery around off and he went down on his knee and tried to slog-sweep it over midwicket. But he top-edged it straight up in the air. Gone! Out for 45.
leans forward to defend to the on side
around the off stump, tapped gently to the off
around the leg stump, swept for a single
on the middle and leg line, tapped gently towards short midwicket
on the off stump line, worked to short mid-on fielder

And Ravindra Jadeja roars! Why not?! A wicket in the first over. It lands on the middle and moves towards leg stump and Angelo pushed down the wrong line. Trapped in front! Jaddu pumps his fist in the air!
flighted around the off stump line, driven to long-off
gets forward to defend it to the off side
aaround the leg stump, swept to short fine-leg region where the ball threatens to spin away from PK who makes a lunging stop and seems to have hurt his ankle
turns away from Kapu who jabs it out to the off
leans forward to drive it to left of mid-off for a single
leans forward to defend back down the track
taps this to midwicket
around the off stump, pushed cautiously to covers
leans forward to wrist it to short midwicket
goes for the sweep but will collect a leg bye in the end
on the off stump line, defended to the off
on the middle stump line, tapped to the on side of the pitch
quicker on the off and middle, pushed to Raina at covers
pushes this to left of mid-off . . confusion over the single but Sehwag has a wild throw at the non-striker's end.
turn there, pitches middle and off, and breaks away. watchfully played
pitches around the same area, goes on straight, defended
hit powerfully this time, but straight to extra cover
looks to sweep it fine, but short fine is very fine
straighter one, Kapu defends, but gets the inside half of the bat
slightly short, and Kapu waits and cuts it away for one
into the pads, worked away to midwicket
clears the front leg and defends it back
swept away well, into the gap, square of deep fine leg
stretches well forward and defends
into the pads again, whipped away wide of midwicket
slower in the air, and Randiv defends it back to the bowler
flighted delivery, and patted off the front foot
powerful drive, nicely timed, but can't beat extra cover
flatter delivery, played back to the bowler
into the pads, not much turn, played towards mid-on
punched away through covers
slower, airier, 81ks, gets turn, and a thick outside edge. But all safe for Kapu
full, flat, played back to the bowler
slightly slower, defended back again
punched off the front foot, but back to the bowler
swept away wide of fine leg
full, again Randiv presses forward and plays it back to the bowler
another long stride down the pitch, and a dead bat presented
poor throw, poor backing up... played towards and they rush through for one, Jadeja throws wide, and Kohli misfields at long-on to convert one overthrow into two
another single stolen, to point region again
defended back to the bowler
punched away, but doesn't miss cover
flighted delivery, defended back again
gives it air again, Kapu looks to make room, but this one doesn't turn away, and consequently gets an inside edge
full and straight, inside half towards midwicket
length ball, around off, hit to mid-off
back of a length, angling across him, pushed to cover
bouncer, fairly accurate, over middle and off, but equally well played, swaying out of its way
slower ball, 122ks, around off, but Randiv is not committing
nice shot, slight width outside off and he throws his bat at it, not off the middle but it clears the cover ring - not many catching on the boundary right now
full and fast outside off, driven straight to extra cover
slower this time, around middle, played back to him

what a soft dismissal, this isn't flighted much, is straight and fast at 90ks, he chips down the pitch half-heartedly, plays down the wrong line and the ball ricochets off the pad to the middle stump. Jadeja blows a kiss, he is loving it
presses forward to defend one outside off
and again, stretches well forward to defend
another forward-defensive to finish off the wicket-maiden
another bouncer to Randiv, and this time he is not able to get out of the line, and is hit in the helmet grille
back of a length, around off, played back to Nehra - he has now pushed him back in the crease
slightly fuller, beats his attempted flick, but was pitched outside leg
hits him in the pad again, down the leg side again
run-out missed. Not a well judged single, hit straight to mid-off and they run, but Karthik misses the stumps. Had he hit, we wouldn't even need the third umpire
outside off, and left alone
full and presses right forward to defend
fuller, flatter, swept away fine of deep backward square
angling into the pads, flicked away for one
nicely played, using all of Jadeja's pace, glancing this gently off the pads, fine of short fine - first boundary in 15 overs
presses forward and defends
worked away with the angle, wide of midwicket for one
superb shot, lovely square cut, neither backward point, not third man, needs to move. Powerfully hit
stays back and defends this one back to Nehra
bouncer, over middle stump, ducks under it
full, hit to mid-off, and they rush through. Karthik misses again, this time, though, he would have sneaked in
nicely driven through extra cover, gets three runs for it
steered away nicely for one - crowd seems to have come alive in the last couple of overs
right forward to defend this one
flicked away from in front of stumps. Randiv wants a single, but rightly sent back
wristy shot again, flicked past midwicket
into the pads again, defended this time
dead-batted off the front foot
wide down the leg side. Dhoni whips the bails off, the third umpire is not called off despite a loud appeal
into the pads again, beats his attempt at turning it around the corner
short outside off, is beaten on the cut shot. No feet
short outside off again, punched away to sweeper-cover
short and wide again, and cut away for one
no slip! no slip there! this is a much better short delivery, effort ball, close to the body, and rising towards the chest. Randiv has to fend at it, and it flies through the vacant slip region
fuller, hit to point this time
shorter again, and nicely punched away, but Raina does well at extra cover
presses forward, and defends this with an angular bat
worked away into the leg side, from in front of stumps
quick, flat, pushed to long-on for one
a bit more air, around off, played back to him
looks to turn this into the on side, finds square leg
another forward-defensive
and right away, he gets drift with a flighted delivery, played to extra cover
another flighted slow delivery, at 73ks, it is at least 15ks slower than Jadeja's stock delivery. Pushed to long-on
swept between deep midwicket and deep backward square
worked off the pads for one
flatter, punched down the ground, but Sehwag dives across the make the save
floated generously again, driven to sweeper-cover for one
short and wide again, Randiv backs away and slashes, and misses
short and wide again, cut away for one this time
Sharma has "cut me" written all over his forehead, and this is the third short and wide delivery of the cover, and Kulasekara gets on top of it and cuts it away powerfully
and short and wide again, Kula leaves it alone this time
which he does again, but this time Kula manages only a bottom edge

those are the kind of overs you hate as a batsman! The guy has been short, the guy has been wide, and suddenly he bowls one in the right area, and you edge it. Just back of a length, just outside off, Kula hangs his bat out there, and the ball kisses the edge
short, on the stumps, 96ks, and he has crunched it past extra cover, after having made room. Top shot, he is playing a valuable hand here
another shot towards extra, Raina dives, makes the save, falls face down, on the ball, which hits him in the groin area
Malinga defends the first ball he faces
flat outside off again, pushed to cover
the first ball Ojha has flighted in this over, defended back
and Malinga gets right behind the line again to defend this one
Randiv takes a single first ball, to fine leg
backing away as he defends this one. Randiv wants a single but is sent back. And correctly so, because half a send after his bat lands, Raina's underarm flick hits the stumps
shot! Top shot, smashed down the ground. Don't bother about the head position, just swing, and swing he did between the bowler and mid-off
expecting a bouncer and is backing away, but Nehra is full and follows him. Malinga gets his bat down in time
now comes the bouncer, pretty close to him too, but Malinga does well to get out of the way
yorker gone wrong, but the full toss is pushed straight to extra cover
smeared in full and fast, Randiv misses the sweep, and they shout for lbw. Not even close! Pitched outside leg, and angling further down
gets a single wide of extra cover this time
low full toss, hit back to the bowler
Malinga gives him the charge, Jadeja bowls short and fast, the inside edge results in a single
very nice shot. Randiv is getting runs that could be crucial here. Makes room, drives this with an open face, between backward point and cover point
quicker delivery, just outside off, Randiv ends up swinging inside the line

and he has got a wicket first ball! Malinga dances down the track, and Ojha slips in the arm ball. Beaten in the flight, Malinga looks to jab at it, but it sneaks in between the bat and the pad. Dhoni does the rest
nicely tossed up around off, defended towards point
appeal for lbw, but there is either an inside edge or it is going down leg anyway
full, defended off the front foot
another run-out missed, another single stolen under mid-off's nose. Jadeja is the culprit this time
super shot! Randiv makes room again, and smashes this shortish delivery between mid-off and extra cover
full, flat, hit to extra cover
backs away, another quick delivery, gets an inside edge, Randiv doesn't turn down the second
he goes over the cover field this time, not well connected but clears the infield
full toss, missed out as he hits it straight to extra cover
worked away off the stumps, gets a single to square leg
straight, fast, defended back to the bowler
back of a length, wide outside off, Randiv swings and misses
short and wide again, but Randiv has backed away too far and can't even reach it
stands his ground, does Randiv. Knows he need not create room, Ishant is giving him ample width anyway, and punches this away nicely to sweeper-cover
better bowling now, short, around off, Fernando fends at it, is beaten
fuller, close to off, Fernando leaves his bat hanging and is beaten
and again, Fernando leaves his bat hanging inside the line. It can also be argued that Sharma hasn't come close enough to draw an edge either

and Randiv perishes while playing the shot that has brought him most of his boundaries! Makes room and looks to go over extra cover again, but this time doesn't get enough behind it and fins Raina. But an important innings nonetheless

inn2.comm: fullish, on the middle and leg, hint of outswing, and DK leans forward, covers the swing and works it through midwicket
lovely delivery; on a length and straightening outside off stump, Karthik gets squared-up and is beaten. Ala Ramnaresh Sarwan
walks couple of steps down the track and works the back-of-length delivery to midwicket
full in length and straight on the middle, the bat comes around the front pad to defend. Again he walked couple of steps down the track
slings across a bouncer and DK ducks.
nasty bouncer, chest-high and DK fends it away ungainly towards gully

The leg stump has been uprooted from earth! It was the low full toss and Sehwag moved outside leg and tried to whack it to the off-side. Swing and a miss. The ball crashed into the stumps. They cross over for a run.
shuffled to the off and tries to flick the inswinger .. it runs off the pad to fine-leg boundary
cuts in from outside off, Sehwag goes for the cut - the bat came down in an angle and the ball flies through to the keeper
feels for the ball outside off and edges it to the on side. Another one that cut back in. Kula special.
fuller in length, just outside off, steered down to third man

well kept by Sanga DK walked down the track for the off drive but got the inside edge as the ball cut back in. The ball moved past the off stump, bounced and was well to the left of Sanga who dived full stretch to stop it with his left-hand

Another inside edge. Almost fatal again. It bounces past the stumps, DK turned back quickly to try prevent it from running on to the stumps but as soon as he realised that his stumps were safe, he responded to Sehwag's call for a run
leans forward to defend compactly to covers
takes a step forward and pushes it to left of mid-off for a single
around the off stump line, pushed to point region
full in length around off stump and Sehwag drives on the up and Dilshan makes a tumbling save
full toss down the leg side, dips down leg, past the attempted flick and Sanga dives to make a half-stop
another lifting delivery into the rib cage and DK fends it away behind square-leg. He took the bottom-hand of the handle and jabbed it away
walks couple of steps down the track and sees its in the zone outside off and shoulders arms
this one straightens outside off, squeezed out to point
fine incutter, DK leans across to defend and gets an inside edge on to his pad.
short in length straightening outside off stump, run down to third man
back of length around off stump, punched to mid-off
cuts in towards off and middle, pushed out to the on side
slower one, full and loopy, DK leans forward to carefully push it towards mid-on
lifting delivery outside off, DK hops to get on top of the bounce, then realises there is no need to play at this one and drops his wrists and gets the bat out of the way
Ouch! Good sharp lifting delivery, at the body this time, DK hops, tries to clip it to the on side and is hit on the body...
And so Malinga fires another bouncer and DK ducks. The ball flies just over his helmet
DK moves outside leg and Malinga slings it full outside off. DK reaches out but can't get bat to ball. He had moved too far
shortish, around off and Karthik jabs it down towards backward point.
shortish again, around chest-high, outside off and Karthik steers it down to backward point
fullish outside off, square driven past the diving Tharanga
Meaty! Full in length and outside off, Sehwag shifts his weight to the back foot and punches it on the up through cover point
tries to drive this on the up towards mid-off but edges it back down the track
outside off stump, steered past backward point
leans well forward to defend to the off side. Sanga was standing up to the stumps
around the off stump, steered past backward point and he will complete two runs.
cuts in towards off and middle, Sehwag, as is his wont, stays beside the line, opens the bat-face and steers it to backward point
fuller in length, on the middle and off line, Sehwag is a touch late in adjusting to the late but manages to lunge forward in the end and edges the defensive poke to his pad.
on the middle stump line, moving in again, Sehwag goes for the on drive but edges it to midwicket. Angelo is looking for the lbw decision here
full in length, straightening on the middle and off line, driven to mid-off
goes back to punch the short-of-length delivery to mid-on
full and on the pads, and sehwag unfurls the leg glance to collect another boundary.
slower one, fullish outside off and squeezed out to shortish point Dilshan
hurls the bouncer this time and DK allows it to pass through to Sanga
climbs from short of length and DK gets back and across to defend
walks down the track and punches to the off side
another bouncer and it flies through to Sanga
leans forward to drive to left of mid-off for a quick single
fullish, around off stump line, driven to mid-off
short in length and outside off, left alone
length delivery that cuts away after landing outside off, left alone
fuller, on a length, on the middle and off, pushed past Sehwag

Caught at third man! It was shortish, it was well outside off and the shot was warranted. He went for the flaying cut shot but ended up slicing it straight to third man near the boundary. Out for a 35-ball 10. One man down.
lands outside off and goes away to Sanga.
cuts in from back of length, moves towards the leg and hits high on the pad. Sehwag was pressing back to try to work it to the on side
in the zone outside off stump, Sehwag goes for the cut and is beaten. Sanga is not sure whether to appeal or not!
fuller, outside off, Sehwag reaches out and ends up digging it out
shortish delivery on the middle, Sehwag hops even as he shuffles across, almost gets outside the line but it climbs even more to ping him on the bottom-hand glove!
back of length outside off stump, steered to backward point

What a lovely catch from Sanga! Fernando teased Kohli with a fuller delivery outside off stump and he fell for the bait. He edged the intended off drive and Sanga flew full stretch with an outstretched right hand to pouch that. What a stunner!
length delivery around off stump, steered to point
full in length outside off stump, Sehwag plays a crashing cover drive but there is a sweeper cover
full in length outside off stump, Rohit gets across to defend

Rohit won't move. He stands still. He has to go. Now he moves. That tendency to plant his front leg across gets him into trouble. Yet again. He then tried to bring the bat around the front pad but by then the ball had moved in to hit him in front of the off stump.  It hit him just above knee roll. He lingered there for a while before he trudged off. Sri Lanka are on the attack here. Rohit showed his bat as if to suggest it had hit the inside-edge. The replays, those shown so far, didn't show any inside edge. They haven't showed snicko yet. And he stood there fora while. The match referee might come into picture
shuffles across to flick this past square-leg
leans forward to punch it between the bowler and mid-on! Crash!
leans forward to push it to the off side
leans forward to defend the length delivery to the off
hops back to punch the back-of-length delivery to point
fine delivery. It cut away from the leg and middle line, Raina tried to work it to the on side and edged it through gully
the bouncer from wide of the crease and Sehwag ducks

shout for lbw but it would have gone over the stumps. It landed short of length on the middle and straightened. Raina was on the back foot, trying to defend and was hit high on the pad in front of middle.
A fine slower one this time! Raina ended up checking his shot and the ball flew to the left of Angelo who lunged out but couldn't reach.
in the zone outside off, left alone
full in length and outside off, left alone
goes right back and across to tap this short-of-length delivery to the off side
works it to midwicket for a single
hops back - it was a short-of-length delivery- and pushes it to the on side
fuller, just outside off, driven to covers
full in length, angling across Raina who pushes it to point
full in length, outside off, punched to left of covers where Randiv makes a fine diving stop
on the leg and middle line, tucked past square-leg
bouncer on the middle stump line and Sehwag ducks
gets back and across to defend.
leans forward to push to left of mid-off
full in length, on the middle, Sehwag tries to flick across the line and edges it to his pad
Whippy! overpitched on the middle and leg line and sehwag whips it to right of mid-on for another boundary.
short of length around off stump, punched to point
leans forward to push this to the on side
gets back and across to defend to the on side
leans forward to dab the length delivery to covers
on the middle and leg, Raina gets a leading edge to covers
this time he moves properly, back and across, and works the ball from the off stump to the on side
the bouncer on the middle stump and Sehwag ducks. Very high bouncer
cuts in from outside off stump and Sehwag gets an inside-edge on to his pad
around the off stump line, jabbed away to short cover region
banged in short, swatted past midwicket
full in length outside off stump and Sehwag punches it to point
on the middle stump line, short in length, worked to short midwicket
shortish, doesn't climb all that high, Raina hops to work it past square-leg
fullish outside leg stump, flicked away to long-leg
banged in short around off stump and Raina gets back to tap it to the off side
length delivery on the middle and off, turned to the on side
slips in a slower one, full and outside off and Sehwag leans across to scoop it over covers.. the sweeper cover moves to the right to stop
gets back to whip the fullish delivery on the middle and leg to deep square-leg region where Randiv makes a super diving stop
fullish around off stump, Sehwag squeezes it down to third man
glides forward to punch the full delivery on the up and in the air but through the gap between the bowler and mid-off.
shout for lbw .. it was a length delivery around off and Raina tries to play it to the on side and is struck on the pad
fullish delivery on the middle and Sehwag crashes it past the non striker. Thump!
Crack! short in length and outside off stump and Sehwag flays it to the point boundary
slower one, short in length, Sehwag goes for the cut and the ball flies over the blade
leans forward to push to the off side
lifting delivery outside off stump, Sehwag jumps to guide to backward point
the bouncer on the middle and leg line, Sehwag ducks
full in length, just outside off, Raina edges the off drive to square-leg
fullish, on the middle stump line, Sehwag whips it superbly through midwicket! Wonderfully wristed away
short in length outside off stump, cut to backward point where Mahela leaps to make a half-stop
fullish outside off stump, edged away for a quick single
short in length, into the rib cage, fended away to short fine-leg
goes back and across to clip it to midwicket
flighted delivery, pushed to long-on for one
and he flicks it from way outside off, between long-on and deep midwicket, comes back for two
straighter one, gets a leading edge, but it is safe
looks to cut a fullish delivery, gets the bottom part of the bat
and he plays the cut again, connecting this time, taking a single
charges down the track and pushes this to midwicket
No-ball Junction is at it! Oversteps, bowls a half-volley too. Sehwag's flick finds mid-on

and Kulasekara has dropped it even though this doesn't matter. It lets Sehwag come back for two. He tried the flick again, and the leading edge lobbed towards mid-on. That's fifty for Sehwag. Responsible, uncharacteristic [not to say he is not responsible, but to say that he has worked hard for these runs] innings
back of a length, flicked away again, along the ground this time
stays back to defend this shortish delivery
lovely shot, just a short-arm punch. It was short and wide, but it needed to be put away into a gap, and he punched it between backward point and third man

Raina has pulled him straight to deep square leg! This isn't even a very good short ball, is asking to be hit, but Raina doesn't hit it off the middle, and the top edge settles with Tharanga, who juggles before taking full control
flicked away from in front of the stumps, gets a single to deep square leg
around off, turning in, Sehwag defends with an open face
gives him the width, cut away for one
stays back to defend this back to the bowler
hurries him up as this quickens at him after pitching, but he does well to get the bat down
flighted around off, pushed to long-off
turning into the pads, played towards midwicket
Short, going for the ribs, but the ball doesn't get up either. Easy single to fine leg
looks to work it off the stumps, but misses. The LBW shout is not good enough because it is headed down the leg side
drops this to cover and runs, sharp single taken
full and wide, and even though he doesn't get close to it, drives it nicely through cover
short, aimed for the chest, keeps it down
short outside off, defended to cover
short again, tucking him up, defended back to the bowler
paddle sweep from around leg, comes back for two
straighter one, around off, defended towards cover
big shout for lbw, they are going for pad first as Dhoni stretches forward to defend. Replays not conclusive. Rauf rules in favour of the batsman
fully forward to defend again, this time it is clearly only bat
pushed wide of the bowler, who makes a desperate dive, gets a hand on it too, but can't prevent the single
high backlift from Sehwag, but curbs the big shot, and pushes this to long-off for one
driven on the up, and Randiv misfields at extra cover, conceding a single
full outside off, drives at it, but this time Randiv does well at extra cover
slight movement back in, Dhoni goes back and covers it and pushes it back to the bowler
fuller, outside off, covers the off stump, and then shoulders arms
short, into the ribs, tucked away for one
short outside off, shapes up for the upper-cut, but then lets it go - he is playing an uncharacteristically patient innings. Yes, patient is the word I have been looking for
back of a length, punched down to long-off for one
short, extra bounce, but Sehwag gets under it and cuts powerfully, not bothering about keeping it down, and there is no backward point there
much better shot! Angled across him, and he waits for it, and then opens the face of it, past the backward point, which has now come in place
easily punched away for a single into the off side
stays back to defend this to cover
stretches forward to turn this to midwicket
slower ball, and nicely steered away to third man
short, into the ribs, nicely tucked away fine, and Fernando makes a mess of it at fine leg. Not coming down in time, and then letting it slip through
short outside off, there is extra bounce there, and he aborts his attempt to run it down to third man
gets on top of this and punches it, but can't beat point
now that is the effort bouncer, Dhoni's both feet are in the air, and then it tails in back towards Dhoni, who drops his wrists and gets his head out of the way
not that high this time, and he drops it towards square leg and sneaks in a single
jumps out of the crease and then gently helps it around the corner for one
pushed between point and cover for one
sharp turn, and then Dhoni aborts the open-face shot and plays it back to the bowler
helped away with the turn, into the one side for one
nicely flicked away between deep square and deep midwicket, but they take only one
pushed to long-on for a strolled single
shot! squeezed through mid-off and extra cover. It's like a hockey shot, so bottom-handed, as if guiding it with his own hands, but all along the ground. It helps that this is a half-volley
looks for the yorker, angles down the leg side, and is worked away for one
slower ball, 112ks, steered away for one
yorker gone wrong again, and the full toss is easily helped away for one
short ball, stays inside the line, keeps the wrists and the bat down, and lets it go harmlessly by
worked away off the hips for one
pushed to sweeper-cover for one
sharp offbreak, Dhoni stays back and defends
comes down the track and works this wide of midwicket for one
stays back to defend this outside off
nicely swept from leg-stump line, square of fine leg, comes back for two
full ball, swiped away towards deep midwicket for one
short ball, pitches and jags down the leg side. Sehwag ducks under it
slower ball, nicely glided away to third man for one
second bouncer for the over, hence called no-ball. He saw Dhoni come down the track and slipped in the short one
fifty runs for the partnership as Dhoni guides this towards deep midwicket
bye bye ball! Gentle short delivery, slower ball, waist high, and he drags it from outside off, and pulls it over deep midwicket. Can he get a century here?
oh yes he can, he surely can get a century here. This is shortish again, angling down the leg side, and he glances it fine. India need 20, Sehwag needs 15
and he retains strike too, cutting this to deep point for one
tossed up teasingly, looks for the big shot, then just defends it. For no particular reason, maybe it is slightly too far outside off
he is in a hurry here, this is pitched on the leg-stump line, and he has swept it for a six over deep square leg. Top hit again, and his strike rate goes over 100. The century is well and truly one
makes room and punches this uppishly through point for one
forward defensive, Dhoni is playing along for Viru's century now
pushed down to long-off for one
and he retains strike by helping this around the corner for one
back of a length, around off, pushed back to Mathews
that's one of those fours! easy pickings too, the fine leg is very square and he glances this off the pads for four easy runs
oh oh, this one gets big at Sehwag, but he manages to keep the pull down
dead-batted back to the bowler
stays back, defends again. Only Sehwag is to score runs from here on
and again defended, over to Sehwag
and what? four byes. Stays low, and goes through the batsman and the keeper. Drama. Sehwag is smiling
Viru looking to do it with a single, pushed to point and sent back
and again he pushes to point and is sent back

match is over, but Sehwag has been denied the century. And this is a big no-ball, must I point out? His back foot was close to over-steeping, forget about the front foot. Anyway Sehwag smashed it for six over long-off, but they don't count because the game finishes at no-ball. He raises his arms, but then realises the century is not completed. Doesn't matter to him. He says: "It often happens. When a batsman is on 99 and the scores are level, bowlers try to bowl no-balls and wides. It happens in cricket. Fair enough." What a man
